alert.note: Alert for Chouteau and Fergus Counties; Hill and Blaine Counties (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 23 at 1:02PM MDT until July 25 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 113 AND 115... The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Hill and Blaine Counties and Chouteau and Fergus Counties. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph, with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * IMPACTS...
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. A combination of gusty winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will create high fire growth potential. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Chouteau and Fergus Counties; Hill and Blaine Counties
